intro: Alectra melampyroides, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are thick and fleshy. Alectra melampyroides is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
